instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message:
Powering on not charging. The board was liquid damaged even on the battery itself. After some time working on it i managed to power it on and i ordered a new battery. When plugged in working normal all good once i plug in the battery it changes to battery and not charging and the green light not turning off even when battery plugged in and it came to that after i replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. Any ideas? 

Thanks :cool:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message:
I recommend to try known good battery; better old original, just for test.
New chinese battery too many crappy.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message: i tried but still the same. In the meantime <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> burned so it stopped powering on, After replacing it with another one it power on but it's overheating <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> cannot touch it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message:
pin 1 0v
pin 2 16.3v
pin 3 3.9v
pin 12 3.4v
pin 14 3.4
pin 19 & 20 5.5v
pin 24 16.4v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage and diode mode to ground?
Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>?
Also post voltage for pins 9, 15, 27.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message:
i Was about ti but this morning found it dead not powering on :eek: going through the power rails again now :D
Edit: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted ... <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> was the issue hopefully now it's gonna be good :cool:

All good Charging with the replacement of the <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> that was the issues all along :p

Thanks 2informaticos
